title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Challenges that arise with factors

Plot order on scales (axes, color scale)
Too many factors
Mapping colours to specific levels (later lesson on colour)

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Plot order
Here’s a plot of mean penguin body mass by species and sex. What’s the order?

penguins %>% ggplot(aes(x = body_mass_g, y = island)) + 
  stat_summary() +
  facet_wrap(~ sex) + theme_bw()

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Plot order
Order from smallest to largest, top to bottom. Watch out for NAs.

penguins %>% na.omit() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
                   y = fct_reorder(species, bill_length_mm,
                                   .desc=TRUE))) + 
  stat_summary() + my_theme

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Custom order
Order from smallest to largest, top to bottom. Watch out for NAs.

penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
             y = fct_relevel(species, "Gentoo", "Adelie"))) + 
  stat_summary() + my_theme

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
section: Challenges that arise with dates and times
text:
Challenges that arise with dates and times

Date format
Extracting components of date or time
Formatting axes on plots
Arithmetic with dates and times
Time zones

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Dates and times

tibble(date = c("2021/03/11 10:05", "2021/03/12 15:12", 
                "2021/03/11 15:14", "2021/03/11 11:50 PM"),
       dt = ymd_hm(date),
       value = 1:4) %>%
  ggplot(aes(y = dt, x = value)) + geom_point(size=4) + my_theme

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Dates and times

tibble(date = c("2021/03/11 10:05", "2021/03/12 15:12", 
                "2021/03/11 15:14", "2021/03/11 11:50 PM"),
       dt = ymd_hm(date),
       value = 1:4) %>%
  ggplot(aes(y = dt, x = value)) + geom_point(size=4) + 
  scale_y_datetime(date_labels = "%H:%M") + my_theme

title: Text, Factors, Dates, and Times
text:
Time arithmetic

t1 %>% mutate(elapsed = dt - min(dt)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = as.numeric(elapsed)/3600, 
             y = value)) + geom_point(size=4) +
  labs(x = "Time in hours since start") + my_theme

Kinds of graphics

Vector graphics (pdf, svg)
Bitmapped or raster graphics (png, jpeg)

Why does it matter?

File sizes
Quality when printed
Appearance on screen

title: Graphics output
text:
Overview

Device types: png, ragg, jpeg, svg, pdf
Size: fig.height, fig.width (in inches, default 7), and fig.asp (aspect ratio: height / width)
Display size: out.width, out.height (in percentage of display area, e.g., ‘70%’)
Resolution: dpi (dots per inch; 96-250 on screen, 300-600 when printed)
Alignment: fig.align = left, right, center

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
The goal

cover image

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Get the data

library(gapminder)
gapminder %>% knitr::kable()

We will make a scatterplot of life expectancy as a function of GDP per capita, for one year only.

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
First Plot
The last year with data is 2007, so let’s take those data and make a scatterplot.

gapminder %>% 
  filter(year == 2007) %>%
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp,
             x=gdpPercap)) + 
  geom_point()

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Change the x-axis to a log scale
text:
Change the x-axis to a log scale
The figure uses \(\log_2\) with fancy labels (and has an error), but we will be content with simple labels.

gapminder %>%
  filter(year == 2007) %>%
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp,
             x=gdpPercap)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  scale_x_continuous(trans = "log2")

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Add axis labels and a title
text:
Add axis labels and a title
Clean up the axis labels. I’ll hide some of the code to make room on the screen.

gapminder %>% 
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap)) + 
  ... + 
  xlab("Income per person, GCP/capita in $/year adjusted for inflation and prices") + 
  ylab("") + 
  ggtitle("Life Expectancy (2007)")

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Add colour
We will use the continent name to pick colours.

gapminder %>% 
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent)) + 
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Make points transparent to highlight overlap
text:
Make points transparent to highlight overlap

  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent)) + 
  geom_point(alpha=0.5) +
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Add a black outline to each dot
text:
Add a black outline to each dot

  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent)) + 
  geom_point(alpha=0.5) +
  geom_point(shape=1, color="black") +
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Match the colour scale to the example
text:
Match the colour scale to the example

  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent)) + 
  ... +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue", "green", "pink", "yellow", "red"))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Make the points bigger
Scale the size of points using the population of each country.

  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent, 
             size=pop)) + 
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Make the points bigger: Part 2
Make the points bigger by setting the maximum size of the points.

  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent, 
             size=pop)) + 
  ... +
  scale_size_area(max_size = 20)

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Hide the legend

  ggplot(aes(...)) + 
  ... +
  theme(legend.position =
          "none")

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Draw a map for the inset
text:
Draw a map for the inset
Get the map data and draw a map. Google a first example.

world <- ne_countries(scale='medium',
      returnclass = 'sf')

world %>%
  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(aes(fill=continent))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Remove Antarctica

world %>% 
  filter(continent != 
           "Antarctica") %>%
  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(aes(fill=continent))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Match the colours to the plot
text:
Match the colours to the plot

world %>% 
  ggplot() + 
    scale_fill_manual(values = 
          c("blue", "pink", "yellow",
            "green", "red", "black", 
            "green" ))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Remove outlines on countries and make colors transparent
text:
Remove outlines on countries and make colors transparent

world %>% 
  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(aes(fill=continent), 
          color=NA, 
          alpha=0.5) +
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Remove the legend

world %>% 
  ggplot() + 
  ... +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Clean up the grid lines, white background
text:
Clean up the grid lines, white background
Lots of help from Google to figure this out!

world %>% 
  ggplot() + ... +
    theme_bw() + 
    theme(legend.position= "none",
      panel.border= element_rect(linetype=0),
      panel.grid= element_line(color=NA),
      panel.background= element_rect(fill=NA),
      plot.background= element_rect(fill=NA),
      axis.text.x= element_text(color=NA),
      axis.ticks.length= unit(0, "cm"))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Store the map in an object for later use
text:
Store the map in an object for later use

world %>% 
  ggplot() + 
  ... -> world_map
print(world_map)

title: Recreating a plot step by step
section: Combine the plot and the map
text:
Combine the plot and the map
And add a floating label for Canada.

ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
           x=gdpPercap)) + 
  annotation_custom(grob=
    ggplotGrob(world_map), 
    xmin=12.3, 
    ymin=35, ymax=50 ) +
  
  geom_label_repel(aes(
          label=country), 
      data = gapminder %>% 
       filter(year ==2007, 
        country=="Canada"), 
    color="black", 
    fill="green", 
    segment.size=1, 
    segment.color="green", 
    box.padding=3) +
  ...

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Adjust the aspect ratio
Use the ratio of width (log units, log2(30000/300)) to height (80-40), scaled to be 1:2 for a wide plot.

gapminder %>%
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, 
             x=gdpPercap, 
             color=continent, 
             size=pop)) + 
  ... +
  coord_fixed(ratio=(1/2)*
                log2(30000/300)/(80-40))

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
How did we do?

cover image

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Final code and plot

gapminder %>% filter(year == 2007) %>%
  ggplot(aes(y=lifeExp, x=gdpPercap, color=continent, size=pop)) + 
  geom_point(alpha=0.5) +
  geom_point(shape=1, color="black") +
  geom_label_repel(aes(label=country), data = 
                     gapminder %>% filter(year ==2007, 
                                          country=="Canada"), 
                                   color="black", fill="green", 
                   segment.size=1, segment.color="green", 
                   box.padding=3) +
  xlab("Income per person, GCP/capita in $/year\nadjusted for inflation and prices") + 
  ylab("") + 
  theme_bw() + 
  ggtitle("Life Expectancy (2007)") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue", "green", "pink", 
                                "yellow", "red")) +
  scale_size_area(max_size = 20) + 
  annotation_custom(grob=ggplotGrob(world_map), 
                  xmin=12.3, ymin=40, ymax=55 ) +
  scale_x_continuous(trans = "log2") +
  theme(legend.position = "none",
        text=element_text(size=16))  +
  coord_fixed(ratio=0.5*log2(30000/300)/(80-40)) -> final_plot

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text: Final plot

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Final map code

world %>% filter(continent != "Antarctica") %>%
  ggplot() + geom_sf(aes(fill=continent), color=NA, alpha=0.5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("blue", "pink", "yellow","green", 
                                 "red", "black", "green" )) +
    theme_bw() + theme(legend.position = "none", 
                     panel.border=element_rect(linetype=0),
                     panel.grid = element_line(color=NA),
                     panel.background = element_rect(fill=NA),
                     plot.background = element_rect(fill=NA),
                     axis.text.x = element_text(color=NA),
                     axis.ticks.length =  unit(0, "cm")) -> world_map

title: Recreating a plot step by step
text:
Libraries used

library(tidyverse)
library(gapminder)
library(ggrepel)
library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthdata)
library(rgeos)

title: Teams
text:
If you know who you want to form a team with (2 or 3 people per team), enter this information in the task repository, file team-planning.Rmd before October 16. You will need to wait until the second week of term to learn how to do this!
By October 24, a document on Brightspace will list

who is on each team,
the schedule of presentations for each team,
the schedule of peer evaluations for each student.
